cab.content: 144SECRET. WAR CABINET.RELATIONS OF UNITED STATES WITH OTTOMAN EMPIRE Copy of letter from Secretary, Allied Naval Council.Admiralty,15th May, 1918.Sir,I am instructed by the Allied Jfaval Council to communicate to you, for the information of the Supreme War Council, the following Resolution that was passed at an Emergency Meeting of the Council held this afternoon at the Admiralty, to consider the questions of the desirability from the Naval point of view of war being declared between tho United States of America and the Ottoman Empire, and between the United States of America and Bulgaria (Paper No.G.T.4505).RESOLUTION.The Alliod Naval Council have considered the recommendations made by the Permanent Military Representatives of the Supreme War Council, in Memorandum No.G.T.4505, regarding an immediate declaration of war between the United States of America and the Ottoman Empire, and a declaration of war between the United States of America and Bulgaria on the expiry of a time limit after negotiations have been conducted.The Allied Naval Council wish to record their opinion that from the Naval point of view also it is desirable that the action recommended by the Military Representatives should be taken.I am, Sir,Your obedient Servant,(Sd.) T.E.Crease.Captain, Royal Navy, Secretary,The Secretary,The Supreme War Council,2, Whitehall Gardens,London.
